results.title: Abused in Public Housing, Victims Often Face a Long Wait to Move
results.abstract: A 2013 provision to federal law was intended to ensure that domestic violence victims living in subsidized housing could move quickly to safer homes. But they often wait in fear.

multimedia.copyright: Kholood Eid for The New York Times
Kholood Eid for The New York Times
Kholood Eid for The New York Times

results.title: Far From Ohio, Haitian Americans Feel the Sting of Threats in Springfield
results.abstract: They charged Donald J. Trump and JD Vance, who spread baseless rumors that Haitians in an Ohio city were eating pets, with imperiling their community for political gain.

multimedia.caption: “It may seem like just politics,” said Karl Racine, who served two terms as attorney general for the District of Columbia and immigrated to the United States from Haiti when he was 6. “But it’s serious business, with the real possibility of violence.”
multimedia.copyright: Alyssa Schukar for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: “It may seem like just politics,” said Karl Racine, who served two terms as attorney general for the District of Columbia and immigrated to the United States from Haiti when he was 6. “But it’s serious business, with the real possibility of violence.”

results.title: Trump Tries to Close Off a Chief Line of Attack: That He’s a Danger to Democracy
results.abstract: Donald Trump has tried to link Democrats’ charge that he poses a “threat to democracy” to threats on his life. Meanwhile, he has heightened his own attacks on his rivals.

multimedia.caption: “Their rhetoric is causing me to be shot at, when I am the one who is going to save the country,” Mr. Trump said in an interview with Fox News Digital.

results.title: Trump Makes Big Promises, With Little Detail, for Michigan’s Auto Industry
results.abstract: At his first campaign event since the apparent assassination attempt on Sunday, Donald J. Trump used dire language to insist that if he loses in November it would crush auto jobs.

multimedia.caption: At his town-hall event on Tuesday night in Flint, Mich., former President Donald J. Trump repeatedly vowed that his tariffs would revitalize the auto industry in Michigan, a crucial battleground state.

results.title: Musk Super PAC Switches Field Plan Again in Arizona and Nevada
results.abstract: The pro-Trump group America PAC, which was founded by the billionaire Elon Musk, has cut ties with a canvassing firm in two battleground states, just seven weeks before Election Day.

multimedia.caption: Elon Musk has been intimately involved in America PAC’s operation, with plans to donate as much as $180 million to back the Trump effort.

results.title: Sheriff Posts Video of 11-Year-Old Charged in Fake School Shooting Threat
results.abstract: Sheriff Mike Chitwood of Volusia County, Fla., said he was exasperated by children making dozens of fake school shooting threats. He has promised to name and post mug shots of every offender.

results.abstract: Sitting and former presidents must be mindful of when and where they play. Ronald Reagan largely gave up the game after a man took hostages while he was at Augusta.

results.title: ‘Show Me Your Hands!’: Officer Recalls 2002 Standoff With Trump Suspect
results.abstract: Ryan W. Routh, who was arrested following an apparent attempted assassination of former President Donald J. Trump, was convicted on an explosives charge after the standoff in North Carolina.

results.title: Trump Suggests Restoring the State and Local Tax Break He Once Limited
results.abstract: Former President Donald J. Trump’s 2017 tax law capped the state and local tax deduction at $10,000. He said on Tuesday that he would lift that limit.

results.abstract: U.S. Steel’s chief, David Burritt, expressed confidence on Tuesday that the sale of the American manufacturer to a Japanese owner would close “on its merits” despite bipartisan backlash.

results.abstract: Jonathan Holloway was Rutgers’ first Black president. He helped the university grow but also faced criticism and questioning in Congress over pro-Palestinian encampments on campus.

results.title: For Duckworth, Preserving I.V.F. Access Is Personal
results.abstract: The Democratic senator has long pressed to safeguard the fertility treatment she used to conceive her children, which has now been thrust into the political conversation.

multimedia.caption: Senator Tammy Duckworth, Democrat of Illinois, at the Capitol on Monday. “I didn’t mean to become an advocate,” she said in an interview. “I just wanted to not have anybody else go through what I did.”

results.title: Presidential Campaigns and Allies Plan $500 Million in TV and Radio Ads
results.abstract: Groups backing Vice President Kamala Harris have reserved $332 million worth of airtime. Just about $194 million in ads will come from groups backing former President Donald J. Trump.
